comments:
I downloaded the package eclipse-SDK-3.0.1-linux-gtk.zip, unzipped it and 
started using the eclipse script in the root directory of eclipse.
Eclipse created the workspace and started normally. I tried to add the view 
"Projects" and got the message described in the bug summary.
The log file said:

Looks like a corrupt install. What tool did you use to extract the build zip
file? ark is known to cause problems.

Does the following work?

unzip -t <eclipse-install>/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.ui_3.0.1/jdt.jar

If not, you might want to delete the install and extract again the contents of
eclipse-SDK-3.0.1-linux-gtk.zip. Make sure you use unzip.

I thought of a corrupt install at first glance, too, so i did not try only once.
I used arc first, then tried unzip. Another way i tried was trying to upgrade 
from 3.00 to 3.01 via online update. Same result as mentioned above.

But have you tried testing the jdt.jar? It was not clear from your comments
whether you tried it.

unzip -t <eclipse-install>/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.ui_3.0.1/jdt.jar

Other thing to have in mind: the Eclipse install has to be extracted to an empty
location.

Sorry, did not try before.
